definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: I had to look over to see if she was reading from a cue card.
sentences.chinese: 这使得我必须仔细检查她是否在阅读大字报。

sentences.english: The angry man ripped off the big character post on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 这个愤怒的男人撕掉了贴在墙上的大字报。

definition: capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
to seize and subject to public criticism (form of persecution during the Cultural Revolution)
Quotations from Chairman Mao Tse-Tung, published from 1964 to about 1976
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
Democracy Wall (1978-1989), esp. during the Beijing Spring democracy movement
fight self-interest and repudiate revisionism (Cultural Revolution slogan)
